hasPart.text: "No zones" are areas around trucks or buses in which cars disappear into the larger vehicle's blind spots. "No zones" can also be defined as areas in which cars are so close to the larger vehicle that they restrict the truck or bus driver’s ability to stop and maneuver safely. A car being in a "No zone" greatly increases the potential for a crash.

hasPart.text: You should signal at least 100 feet before you turn, before every lane change, at least five seconds before you change lanes on a freeway, before pulling next to the curb or away from the curb, even when you do not see other vehicles around you, and when you are almost through the intersection if you plan to turn shortly after crossing the intersection. about.name: In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead?

hasPart.assesses: In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead? | In which of the following scenarios should your wheels not be pointed straight ahead? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: While waiting to turn left, keep your wheels pointed straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. If a vehicle hits you from behind, this will prevent you from veering into oncoming traffic. When parked facing either uphill or downhill, turn the wheels so the vehicle will not roll into traffic if the brakes fail.

suggestedAnswer.text: When waiting to make a left turn at a traffic light.

comment.text: When waiting to make a left turn at a traffic light.

suggestedAnswer.text: When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.

comment.text: When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.

suggestedAnswer.text: When parked on the side of a level roadway where there is no curb.

comment.text: When parked on the side of a level roadway where there is no curb.

acceptedAnswer.text: When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.

comment.text: When parked on a hill or sloping driveway.

answerExplanation.text: While waiting to turn left, keep your wheels pointed straight ahead until it is safe to start your turn. If a vehicle hits you from behind, this will prevent you from veering into oncoming traffic. When parked facing either uphill or downhill, turn the wheels so the vehicle will not roll into traffic if the brakes fail.

about.name: When is it legal for minors to use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving?

hasPart.assesses: When is it legal for minors to use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving? | When is it legal for minors to use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: It is illegal for minors to use a cell phone at all while driving, except to contact an emergency entity in an emergency situation. For adult drivers, the use of hands-free devices is permitted; however, to avoid distractions, it is advisable to make calls only if needed to call for help in an emergency.

suggestedAnswer.text: When making a call while stopped at the red light

comment.text: When making a call while stopped at the red light

suggestedAnswer.text: When making a call for emergency assistance

comment.text: Never

acceptedAnswer.text: When making a call for emergency assistance

comment.text: When making a call for emergency assistance

For adult drivers, the use of hands-free devices is permitted; however, to avoid distractions, it is advisable to make calls only if needed to call for help in an emergency.
